file_insights.changes: Updated with detailed performance results for direct vs plan mode indicator computations

patterns_discovered: Plan mode is consistently slower (1.4-2.2x) than direct mode across indicator computations
Fusion strategies introduce computational overhead that exceeds memory bandwidth savings
Multi-output write patterns and complex fusion kernels prevent optimal performance
gotchas_discovered: Welford's algorithm for running statistics involves expensive division operations
Buffered writes add unnecessary copying overhead

approach_outcome.primary_recommendation: Abandon plan-based architecture, use direct mode for all indicator computations
key_findings: Plan mode slower for all tested configurations
Fusion does not provide performance benefits
Direct sequential computation is faster than plan-based approach

recommendations: Remove plan infrastructure from core library
Simplify public API to direct indicator calls
Keep fusion kernels as internal optimizations only where proven beneficial
Maintain simple kernels to enable auto-vectorization
